info.name: Anterior choroidal artery
info.description: The anterior choroidal artery is a long, thin branch from the internal carotid artery prior to the bifurcation of the internal carotid into the anterior and middle cerebral arteries. It supplies the optic tract, choroid plexus in the inferior or temporal horn of the lateral ventricle, as well as parts of the cerebral peduncle, thalamus and hippocampus.
